East Norriton Township is a great place to live or just to visit! It has a total land area of 6.1 square mile and is bordered by Plymouth Township, Whitpain Township and West Norriton Township. East Norriton has a rich history that dates back to the 1600's when William Penn included it in one of the early manors called Williamstadt.

Take the Pennsylvania Turnpike to the Norristown Exit, or take the Schuylkill Expressway to the Plymouth Meeting Germantown Pike Exit. Exit onto Germantown Pike traveling West. Proceed on Germantown Pike west approximately 3 miles and you will arrive at Route 202/Dekalb Pike. Make a left onto Stanbridge Street and proceed approximately Â½ mile. The municipal building complex will be on your right.

East Norriton is a car friendly town. If you can get access to a car that is the best way to get around. Biking is also an option as well as walking. If none of these are viable options, there is public transportation:
SEPTA transportation runs throughout East Norriton and surrounding towns and cities. SEPTA buses serve a large number of neighborhoods in bordering regions and runs frequently.
The SEPTA Regional Rail is located in Norristown, a Borough which is located a few minutes from East Norriton, and can transport travelers all the way to Center City, Philadelphia.

value: is a scenic 690 acre park located in East Norriton, Norristown and West Norriton. This beautiful park includes two branches of the Stony Creek, nature trails, pavilions for picnicking and concerts, a trout nursery and historical structures dating back to the 18th century such as mills and unique Continental style farm houses. Aside from these features, the Farm Park also has untouched woodland areas that are great for exploring.
content= Open 24 Hours. 50 lanes and over 3,000 league bowlers. Steppy's Bar and Grille is attached to the bowling alley. Great food and atmosphere.
content=Suite 104, 10,000 square foot indoor fun center that features giant inflatables and climbing structures.
content=Directly behind municipal building, 21 acres including lighted softball field, picnic pavilion, tennis courts, basketball courts, sand volleyball courts and bocce courts.

Located at the intersection of Dekalb Pike (Rt 202) and Germantown Pike. Stores include: TJ Maxx, Big Al's Aquarium, Horseatack, Caparo Jewelers, Gamestop, Dress Barn, Payless Shoes, Dollar Tree, Starbucks.
Located at West Germantown Pike and Swede Road. Stores include: Shulers Jewelers, TBS Nails, Tobacco and Dollar Store, Sal's Hairstylig, Zounds Hearing Aids, Kumon Learning Center, Leslie's Poolmart.
Located on Swede Road. Stores include: ShopRite, Joanne Fabric, Retro Fitness

East Norriton has some really yummy options for dining out! Here are some of the most popular among residents.

value: content= It is the ultimate sushi and seafood buffet. Meals range from $15-$30.
content=A diner experience that brings you back in time to the 50's! Meals range from $10-$20.
Swede Square Shopping Center, +1 610 275-1403, great for a quick slice of pizza but they also offer Italian style food such as pasta. Meals range from $5-$15.
95 East Germantown Pike, +1 610 382-1517, delicious salads, sandwiches and soups. Meals range from $8-$15.
West Germantown Pike and Swede Road, a quiet little shop to get coffee and a bagel. Meals range from $5-$8.
West Germantown Pike and Swede Road, sit down or take out menu and an ice cream shop attached for take out. Meals range from $10-$25.
West Germantown Pike and Swede Road, delicious and freshly made hoagies. Meals range from $8-$15
content= Italian sit down restaurant and beer retailer. Meals range from $20-$45.
101 Germantown Pike, +1 610 277-6550, Panera is a chain that serves salads, sandwiches and soups. Meals range from $8-$15

There aren't many bars in East Norriton but there is a bigger night life located in West Norriton, which is about a 5 minute drive from East Norriton. Here are some options in East Norriton:
There is only one hotel in all of East Norriton but it is in a great location near a lot of shops and places to eat!
The East Norriton Township's website has information on community events, township news, and contact information for various departments.
Germantown Pike is the best road to use because it attaches to 476 which will then attach to 95, which can connect you with other major highways.
